column4: hi, i cannot enter in my webserver apache: it told me "You don't have permission to access / on this server."
your webserver root needs to be readable by the www-data user
how i could do it??
make sure your webserver root is readable by everone or at least readable by the user www-data
how i could see that?
it does
are you talking about the directory /var/www? it is under root user...
thats right
found, /var/www is property of ROOT user. full control
yes, www-data needs it
i should to change this directory /var/www in order to get properties by my user?
not sure what I'm not making clear?
your web root needs to be readable by the user www-data
ok. found it! changing /var/www readeble by www-data
i changed... but localhost don't work....
ubottu is apache running now ?
yes.. it work, but, i've not permession..
show me ls -la /var/www in a pastebin
it's not supported, it's not a stable platform

I know, I know. I'm an archlinux user myself but my friend would love to use Ubuntu with the gnome3 interface. While I know it's not supported, I was hoping I could get a little more advice other than to use that PPA, as last time I tried to use it with a distupgrade it merely rendered the X login session unuseable.
so you know it doesn't work with ubuntu.....why are you trying to use it.
I know it can be done. I've seen it done before. I just know the way I'm told to do it doesn't work.
it can't always be done, it depends on a lot of things, it won't work for everyone
Ah, I see. I guess I will just wait for 11.10.
